page.title: 01RHAGYMADRODD--INTRODUCTION
page.content: Botwnnog is a small village in the Lleyn Peninsula.The two schools, chapel,church and post office provide a focal point for the surrounding farms and the few houses in the village.The area is dominated by farming,many farms suppliment their income by appealing to the tourist trade which is of importance in the summer months.The many caravan parks add substantially but temporarily to the population of the area. Botwnnog and the surrounding area is predominately Welsh speaking In appearance the village is a ribbon of buildings from chapel to primary school.To the North it is sheltered by a hillside on which the Secondary school and church are situated. Both schools provide Welsh-Medium education for the children.The Welsh language is prominent in all aspects.
